author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Volodymyr Verbianyi, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: The resignation of Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s chief of staff leaves the Ukrainian president deprived of his most important adviser at a critical moment in the fight against the Russian invasion.
title: Zelenskiy Left Exposed by Loss of Top Aide as US Pressure Mounts

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Alberto Nardelli
description: A Ukrainian delegation is heading to the US for further discussions over a peace plan pushed by President Donald Trump, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Ukrainian Team Heads to US for Talks With Trump Envoy Witkoff

author: Madlin Mekelburg, Jimmy Jenkins
description: The killing of a National Guard member in Washington DC has revived attention on the use of capital punishment in the US. Attorney General Pam Bondi said authorities will seek the death penalty for the individual arrested in the Nov. 26 shooting of the service member and a colleague who was critically wounded. They were in the US capital as part of President Donald Trump’s deployment of military personnel to American cities.
title: Killing of National Guard Member Puts US Death Penalty in Focus

author: Catherine Lucey, Josh Wingrove, Jimmy Jenkins
description: President Donald Trump threatened a slew of aggressive actions to curtail legal migration to the US in response to one National Guard member dying after being ambushed near the White House, though the scope of those moves and what legal or congressional mechanisms he may pursue remain unclear.
title: Trump Pledges Strict Immigration Curbs as Details Remain Scarce

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump spoke with Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro last week and the two discussed a possible meeting, according to the New York Times, as the US ramps up pressure on Caracas ahead of potential military strikes.
title: Trump and Maduro Discussed a Possible Meeting, NYT Reports

author: Brian Platt
description: Canada’s government is willing to negotiate with more provinces beyond Alberta on lifting clean electricity regulations if they have equivalent policies, Energy Minister Tim Hodgson said.
title: Carney’s Energy Chief Open to Negotiating on Clean Power Rules

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: Peruvian President José Jerí said he is pushing ahead with plans to declare a state of emergency as migrants block the country’s southern border with Chile, from where undocumented foreigners are apparently fleeing ahead of a threatened crackdown on migration.
title: Peru’s Jerí to Declare Emergency as Migrants Block Chile Border

author: Ntando Thukwana, Monique Vanek
description: South Africa’s central bank governor warned that the US move to exclude the country from the Group of 20 next year was placing the international gathering at risk.
title: South Africa Warns Trump’s G-20 Snub Sets Dangerous Precedent

author: Zoltan Simon
description: President Vladimir Putin and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban met at the Kremlin on Friday to discuss the fate of sanctioned Russian refineries that have triggered concerns about fuel shortages across eastern Europe.
title: Putin, Orban Discuss Fate of Russia’s Sanctioned Oil Refineries

author: Tom Rees
description: Credit-rating companies raised doubts about Rachel Reeves’ plans to postpone the pain from her budget until around the time the next UK general election is due.
title: Credit Rating Firms Doubt Reeves Can Deliver UK Budget Pain

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia is moving toward a full block of messaging app WhatsApp after degrading the service for months, taking another step to replace Western communication and technology platforms with domestic ones.
title: Russia Warns of Full WhatsApp Block as It Pushes Domestic Apps

author: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu
description: Romania’s government is mounting a second attempt to overhaul a generous pension system for the judiciary, in a test for its ability to push through reforms and narrow the European Union’s widest budget deficit.
title: Romania Makes New Attempt to Reform Judiciary Pensions

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves was told the scale of a critical downgrade to Britain’s productivity prospects on Aug. 7, more than three months ahead of the budget, according to Office for Budget Responsibility Chair Richard Hughes.
title: Reeves Knew Extent of UK Productivity Hit in August, OBR Says

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his powerful chief of staff and lead negotiator in peace talks, Andriy Yermak, resigned after becoming ensnared in a corruption investigation.
title: Top Zelenskiy Aide Quits Amid Ukraine Corruption Allegations

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth, Ott Ummelas
description: Norway is likely to keep aid for Ukraine close to current levels beyond next year, a senior opposition lawmaker signaled, citing a low chance of peace anytime soon.
title: Norway Set to Keep Ukraine Aid Steady for Longer, Lawmaker Says

author: Patricia Laya, Andreina Itriago
description: At Via Appia, a deli tucked into a leafy neighborhood in eastern Caracas, the well-heeled customers were loading up one recent morning on the half-turkeys, pecan pies and mashed sweet potatoes. Never mind that Thanksgiving isn’t even a holiday in Venezuela or, for that matter, that just a few nights before President Nicolás Maduro had taken to the airwaves to implore his compatriots to “give their lives” if necessary to fend off a US invasion.
title: Venezuelans Ignore Trump’s Warships and Jump Into Holiday Season

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Lawmakers in Germany’s lower house of parliament gave their final approval to the government’s 2026 budget, including net new federal borrowing of €98 billion ($114 billion).
title: German Lawmakers Back 2026 Budget With €98 Billion in Net Debt

author: Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz sent a letter to European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, urging the head of the bloc’s executive arm to soften the EU’s planned ban on combustion-engine vehicles.
title: Merz Sends Letter to EU in Push to Relax Pending Combustion Ban

author: Catherine Lucey
description: Jeanine Pirro, the US attorney for the District of Columbia, said the suspected gunman in the shooting of two National Guard members will be charged with first-degree murder after the death of a guardsman.
title: DC Suspect to Face First-Degree Murder After Guard Member Dies

author: Alan Crawford
description: Human rights lawyer Oleksandra Matviichuk sits down with Bloomberg in Berlin on her tour to champion her country’s cause.
title: Ukrainian Nobel Prize Winner Sees World at a Defining Moment

author: Irina Anghel
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves may have saved Christmas for Britain’s hard-pressed retailers.
title: Britons Get Ready for ‘Last Hurrah’ Christmas After Budget

author: Jim Wyss
description: Additional US Marines being sent to Haiti to defend the embassy from gang attacks face a grim reality: They’re increasingly being targeted by American-made, military-grade firearms.
title: Gangs Wielding American Guns Await US Marines Heading to Haiti

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukrainian forces say they have once again attacked Rosneft PJSC’s Saratov oil refinery in Russia’s Volga region as the US pushes for a resolution to the Kremlin’s nearly four-year-old invasion of Ukraine.
title: Ukraine Says It Hit Saratov Refinery in Russian Volga Region

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Germany’s ruling coalition agreed on measures including €10 billion ($11.6 billion) in subsidies for the pension system in an effort to win support for its reform bill in parliament next week.
title: Germany Proposes €10 Billion Plan to Win Deal on Pension Bill

author: Levin Stamm, Fabienne Kinzelmann
description: Swiss politicians filed a criminal complaint with the country’s top prosecutor over a Rolex table clock and an engraved gold bar presented to US President Donald Trump by business executives shortly before he agreed to cut tariffs on the country’s exports.
title: Swiss Lawmakers File Criminal Complaint Over Trump-Tariff Gifts

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: Andriy Yermak’s apparent entanglement in an anti-corruption probe is potentially a seismic development for the direction of the war.
title: Zelenskiy May Be About to Lose His Top Aide

author: Craig Stirling, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy managed to notch up some slight growth in the third quarter amid support from domestic demand, instead of just stagnating as originally estimated.
title: Italy Eked Out Some Economic Growth in Third Quarter After All

author: Andrea Palasciano, Alex Wickham, Alberto Nardelli
description: Negotiations for the UK to join the European Union’s flagship €150 billion ($173 billion) defense fund have failed, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Talks for UK to Join Flagship EU Defense Fund End in Failure

author: Manolo Serapio Jr
description: The International Criminal Court denied former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte’s appeal for interim release, in a further setback for the ex-leader who’s charged with crimes against humanity.
title: ICC Denies Ex-Philippine Leader Duterte’s Appeal for Release

author: Sotiris Nikas
description: Greek Finance Minister Kyriakos Pierrakakis will run for the presidency of the Eurogroup, a role from which he could lead one of Europe’s key economic decision-making bodies.
title: Greece’s Pierrakakis Seeks to Lead Euro-Area Finance Chiefs

author: Derek Alberts
description: One of former South African President Jacob Zuma’s daughters resigned as a national lawmaker following a report that she had recruited young men to serve in Russian forces in its war against Ukraine.
title: Zuma’s Daughter Quits as Lawmaker Over Russia Recruitment Report

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile’s ultra-conservative presidential candidate José Antonio Kast opened up a roughly twenty-point lead over his leftist contender ahead of the December runoff as voter perceptions of him improved, according to a new poll.
title: Chile’s Jose Antonio Kast Opens Up Twenty-Point Lead in Presidential Poll

author: Derek Decloet
description: Mark Carney came to power in Canada by pitching himself as an economic crisis fighter who could fix the country’s ruptured relationship with the US. Seven months after he won a national election, the economy is in a fragile state, and a trade truce with the Trump administration has been elusive.
title: How Carney Needs a New Playbook to Counter Trump in Trade Talks

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Arne Delfs
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz said his governing coalition will seek to loosen an effective ban on combustion-engine vehicles in the European Union as Germany seeks to ease pressure on its embattled carmakers.
title: Germany Calls on EU to Soften Combustion Ban to Aid Carmakers

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. ordered local authorities to reach out to Malaysia and Singapore where he said a former lawmaker may be hiding his aircraft that are among assets Manila has frozen as part of a corruption crackdown.
title: Marcos Seeks Singapore, Malaysia Help Over Ex-Lawmaker’s Planes

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Giorgia Meloni’s government is exploring ways to change its financial oversight rules without losing its banking deal veto power, as it seeks to defuse a potential clash with the European Union.
title: Italy Seeks to Keep Bank Veto As It Tweaks Golden Power Rules

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan lifted its forecast for economic growth next year as exports continue to surge on AI demand.
title: Taiwan Raises 2026 Growth Outlook as AI Boom Helps Exports

author: Galit Altstein
description: Several Israeli soldiers were wounded in a deadly overnight battle with militants during on operation inside Syria, one of the worst flareups near the countries’ border this year.
title: Israeli Forces Wounded in Deadly Battle With Militants in Syria

author: Yoshiaki Nohara, Takashi Hirokawa
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s ruling coalition added three independent lawmakers, securing a majority in the powerful lower house of parliament ahead of two key budget votes.
title: Takaichi Obtains Majority in Lower House Ahead of Budget Votes

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan is set to spend roughly ¥252.5 billion ($1.6 billion) in an extra budget to further support developments of artificial intelligence and semiconductors.
title: Japan to Spend $2 Billion on AI, Semiconductors in Extra Budget

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukrainian anti-corruption authorities conducted searches into the premises of Andriy Yermak, the influential top aide to President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
title: Ukrainian Anti-Graft Bodies Search Top Zelenskiy Aide Premises

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan plans to increase its issuance of short-term debt to help finance Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s economic package, a move that comes as markets grow uneasy about fiscal discipline and upward pressure on super-long yields.
title: Japan to Issue More Short-Term Debt to Fund Takaichi’s Stimulus

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban will meet President Vladimir Putin as Russia weighs the sale of sanctioned refineries that have triggered concerns about fuel shortages across eastern Europe.
title: Orban to Meet Putin With Eye on Russia’s Sanctioned Refineries

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Swiss voters are poised to reject an inheritance tax proposal targeting super-rich residents, mindful of the risk of an exodus from one of Europe’s most alluring havens for billionaires.
title: Billionaire Haven Switzerland Set to Reject 50% Inheritance Tax

author: Jana Randow, Mark Schroers
description: Europe’s central bankers are stepping beyond their traditional role as guardians of price stability.
title: ECB Officials Look Beyond Inflation to Bigger Threats for Europe

author: Michael Nienaber
description: German lawmakers are set to approve spending €2.9 billion ($3.4 billion) on 11 military procurement contracts, including for drones, rifles and missiles, in deals that will go largely to domestic manufacturers.
title: Germany Set to Approve €2.9 Billion in Arms in Defense Surge

author: Michael D McDonald
description: China’s campaign to deprive Taiwan of diplomatic recognition risks a rare reversal this month when voters in Honduras choose their next president.
title: Taiwan Eyes a Rare Victory Over Beijing in Honduras Election

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: President Donald Trump announced sweeping plans to crack down on immigration, saying current policy has eroded national progress and that he would “permanently pause migration from all Third World Countries to allow the US system to fully recover.”
title: Trump to ‘Permanently Pause’ Migration From ‘Third World’

author: Swati Gupta, Shruti Srivastava
description: India’s move to distill its byzantine labor laws and get rid of obsolete rules will boost jobs and investment, according to the top bureaucrat handling the exercise, who pledged to complete the overhaul by early next year.
title: India Labor Czar Says Biggest Reform Since 1947 Will Boost Jobs

author: Josh Xiao
description: China complained to Malaysia and Cambodia about the trade deals they signed with the US last month, underscoring the delicate balance countries must strike in the rivalry between Beijing and Washington.
title: China Demands Malaysia, Cambodia Clarify Trade Deals With US

author: Gonzalo Soto, Alex Vasquez
description: Mexico’s Attorney General Alejandro Gertz Manero resigned under pressure from President Claudia Sheinbaum, who had grown increasingly frustrated over his handling of high-profile investigations.
title: Sheinbaum Pushes Attorney General Out Amid Fuel Smuggling Probe

author: Malcolm Scott
description: Rising tensions with China may shave about 0.2 percentage point off Japan’s gross domestic product growth if tourism and the export of consumer goods to the world’s second-largest economy decline, according to economists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
title: Goldman Sees China Spat Weighing on Japan’s GDP Via Tourism Hit

author: Philip Glamann
description: Top Chinese diplomat Wang Yi used a call with his French counterpart to say the two sides needed to back each other, underscoring Beijing’s push to win diplomatic backing during a spat with Japan.
title: China Turns to France for Support During Its Feud With Japan

author: Alex Wickham
description: Britons reacted overwhelmingly negatively to Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ budget, the first opinion poll since it took place has found, suggesting little relief for the Labour government’s slumping popularity.
title: Reeves Budget Calms Markets and Party But Leaves Britons Unhappy
